subject: Management
title: Embedding in Systems
description: A 60-second lesson on Embedding in Systems.

hook.text: A safety initiative worked while the champion was there. She transferred. Safety metrics collapsed in months.

buildup.text: Change that depends on one person isn't change. It's a temporary program.

discovery.text: Sustainable change lives in systems: processes, metrics, incentives, hiring criteria, and tools.

twist.text: If you can remove the leader and the change survives, it's embedded. If it doesn't, it wasn't real.

climax.text: Bake the change into hiring, onboarding, promotion criteria, and daily workflows. Make it structural.

punchline.text: Real change outlives its champion. Build it into the system.

quiz.question: How do you make organizational change permanent?
options: Embed it in systems like processes, incentives, hiring, and workflows
Rely on a strong leader to keep pushing the change forward
Change is automatically permanent once it's been announced
